div.div: First graders conduct sound experiments at home as part of remote learning
Congratulations to both the girls and boys ski teams on another amazing season! Both teams placed second at the Division 2 State Finals.
The Harbor Springs High School Band recently received superior ratings - scores of straight 1's at Festival!
Our students support local families that are facing challenges with battling cancer!
8th grade students pose at Lyric Theatre prior to viewing The Outsiders as the culmination to a unit of study.

h2.a: Video Message from Superintendent Michael Behrmann, April 23, 2020

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-08fcd45 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h5: HSPS will be implementing its Remote Learning Plan that will begin on April 20, 2020. Please click the link above to access all information regarding learning, grading, resources, and announcements regarding the HSPS response to COVID-19. Lunches will still be provided to any child under 18 within District boundaries. Two lunches per student will be distributed at Harbor Springs Middle School, Stutsmanville Chapel, or home delivery on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. To schedule home delivery, please call 231-526-4540 or email Mr. Behrmann at mbehrmann@harborps.org

h2.a: HSPS now taking bids for the Shay Site Redevelopment Project. Click here for more information.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-417ac92 elementor-section-stretched elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h1: Welcome to Harbor Springs Public Schools!

div.p: As one of the finest school districts in Michigan, Harbor Springs Public Schools has earned a reputation of providing excellence with a focus on the three A’s: Academics, Athletics, and the Arts. The following are key factors which make our schools a desired district of choice: Top-ranked SAT Scores, an optimal size district where faculty and staff can connect with every student and parent, a highly qualified, caring and dedicated faculty and staff, an open and inviting school climate where parent involvement is welcome and appreciated. Harbor Springs Public Schools is supported by a prideful community and features outstanding facilities. Its schools are situated in one of the most beautiful areas in Michigan.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-b958307 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

p.br: Application deadline: Friday, May 8, 2020 – view posting

Blackbird Elementary is now accepting applications for 4 year olds!
Please call 526-4545 to schedule an appointment. GSRP grants available

p.span:
Large Group Instruction Room
Harbor Springs Middle School
800 State Road
Harbor Springs, MI 49740

div.h2: Char-Em ISD Special Education Millage Renewal and Restoration May 5, 2020

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-76f4a90 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: The Harbor Springs Ram Wellness Program helps children and teens gain confidence and learn strategies to be more successful in and out of the classroom. The school-based behavioral health program is operated by Health Department of Northwest Michigan in collaboration with Harbor Springs Public Schools. The licensed social workers offer individual, group, and family therapy conveniently located in Harbor Springs Public Schools. Ram Wellness is part of a comprehensive system of HSPS student mental health services. Click here for more information regarding services and referrals.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-fb64050 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Superintendent Michael Behrmann invites parents and community members to join him at monthly Chat with the Superintendent sessions. These informal gatherings are designed to allow for dialogue and a chance to ask questions, express a concern, make a suggestion, or just to say hello. Due to the school building closure for the remainder of the year, the meetings will be held remotely (via Zoom, Google Hangouts, etc.). More information will follow.

div.h2: Middle School Musical, "Into the Woods, Jr." was a huge hit!

div.p: Our middle school students, under the direction of Annie Parada, were magnificent as they acted, dance, and sang in the Broadway musical, “Into the Woods, Jr.” The mystical tale featured a conglomeration of characters and well-known fairy tales. Great job to everyone in the musical and who helped produce the wonderful performance. See the video below for a few highlights!

div.h2: Harbor Springs High School Band earns straight 1's at Festival!

div.p: We are proud of our exceptional high school band program where nearly one-third of our students participate. On February 26, 2020, the band received straight 1’s at Festival – superior ratings – and the highest possible. Under the direction of Pat Ruddy, the band continues to perform at high standards. Be sure to check out the short video of our jazz bands performing along side of the well-known Rodney Whitaker Septet! Click here for the video.

h3.a: Harbor Springs Public School Facilities Use

div.p: Any group or organization that wishes to use a room or facility is asked to complete a “Facilities Use Form” by using the link below. Requests must be received a minimum of ONE WEEK prior to the requested date. Facilities Rules and Regulations Facilities Use Form

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-175 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-home-page-latest-news

div.p: Many families are unaware that they may be eligible for free or reduced price meals for their children. Please view the application below and apply at any time during the school year. 2019-20 Free and Reduced Meal Application
